fields.description: At present, we're using Versions for our Software Versions (e.g. 0.9.0) and Sprints (e.g. Sprint 1) and then use the hierarchy to set Parents to Children e.g. Version 0.9.0 includes Sprint 1, Sprint 2 and Sprint 3. Then use the drop down list in the Planning Board (right hand column above 'versioning boxes') to display Sprints alongside Versions, Components etc.

fields.description:
Today Greenhopper only shows the required fields from a transition screen when performing a workflow action. I my case, I want the developer to write a comment when a issue is dragged from "in progress" into "to do", meaning progress has stopped, as well as updating the priority (put it to blocker, if the issue is blocked etc.).

Transition screens should be honoured in greenhopper as well. In stead of having a customized transition screen from GH, maybe have a option to use a iframe popping the JIRA transition screen. 

This issue was created after a forum post here: http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/site/posts/list/405.page
fields.summary: As a developer, I would like to see the comment field in my transition if this one is in the transition screen since this one cannot be required but is very often used.
Implement CardBoardAction.hasMenuItems

fields.description:
The use case is quite often I just want to reduce the task board (regardless of the active context) to view to those issues assigned only to me and  then as needed, switch to seeing all issues within the active  context.  A simple check box next to "Auto assign" would work on the task board main screen.

I don't want to have to create 2 contexts for every context I have now  - one for "Planning - My issues" and 1 for "Planning - All issues", "Default - My issues" and 1 for "Default - All issues",etc.

Frankly it would be a great checkbox to see on the planning board too  as well as the task board.

If this confuses some GH users, maybe allow the display of this  checkbox to be controlled via configuration .

fields.description:
I frequently copy a version's Release Notes for pasting into things like Basecamp for clients who do not have JIRA access. What would be helpful is if I could choose from a number of common formats when generating release notes. Specifically, Textile support would be nice.

A few others might be...

* Pretty (the current format)
* Plain Text
* HTML source
* Textile
* LaTeX (who knows! :) )

Separately, does JIRA make it possible to generate release notes for unreleased versions? I often want to send a list of things scheduled for release to clients, even though the version has not been "released" in JIRA.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to view the release Notes in Text format.

fields.description: Change height of the TextArea

fields.description:
I like the cards on the Task Board. And I like filling in my time there on a daily basis. But I'm getting old (and therefore forgetful) and would like to be able to see what the title of the summary is that I'm logging time for. 

Please add the item's title/summary at the top of the card when entering the "Log work" form.
fields.summary: Show item summmary when logging time in Task Board
Add the background color of the issue types for each issues in the overview.
As a GH user I would like to have a better feel of the issues presented in the pagination overview

fields.description:
The JIRA timetracking feature allows to specify how many days per week are work days, and I have it set to 5 days.
In Israel, 5 days work week starts on Sunday and ends on Thursday, unlike most countries where Sunday is the day off.

When looking at GreenHopper burn down charts - the non-working days are automatically set to Saturday and Sunday, and it's just plain wrong.
I could not find any way to make GH think otherwise.

Would be nice if there was a configuration item where first day of the week can be chosen, either Sunday or Monday.
fields.summary: GreenHopper assumes that 5 days a week means Monday to Friday

Implement a Sorter by release date for FixVersion

fields.description:
Hi,

We recently use jira and greenhopper in our project and we are facing a difficulty. We use the greenhoper ranking to prioritize the issue. The queue/line of issues provided by greenhopper fulfill our needs except on one point, the initialization. 

When a new issue is created, currently the issue is put in the last position of the queue. However, it could be usefull is there is a rule on creation to help greenhopper putting the issue on the right position. 
For example, in our company, we would like that the issue is put on the queue according to the following criteria :
- the priority
- the creation date if the priority are equals
- if priority and date are equals, the last created on last position

This way, the first priorization is automatic and the managers just have to reorder the queue if needed but a huge part of the work is automatically made by the custom field. 

Is it possible to associate this kind of rules for the greenhopper ranking custom fields so that some fields could be used to calculate the initial order in the queue ?
fields.summary: Add a setting to modify the initialization of JIRA Software ranking
Add setting in Global configuration
Add setting in Project configuration

fields.description:
If Component is a required field, the quick card creation should make it required also - currently it does not do this.

Also, if JIRA is configured so that the "Automatic" Assignee is a component lead, quick card creation should default to this person too instead of the project lead.
fields.summary: Quick card creation should allow the Component field to be required and also default the assignee to the component lead (if JIRA is configured for this)

fields.description:
The enterprise version of JIRA has Project Categories and it would be great if Greenhopper would support this on Task Board. So a developer could not only see his/her tasks for one project but for multiple ones.

We have many projects and it is very inconvinient to check them all one-by-one by selecting them from dropdown menu just to see if there is a task waiting to be done. 

It is inconsistent if one applies already created JIRA filter, which includes criterion on available projects and then GreenHopper plugin disregards this with project selected from drop down selection in the task board.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like my Task Board to display multiple projects at once

fields.description:
We are using the greenhopper plugin and JIRA for agile project management tool.
Some of the scrum team members are complaining that they need to remember to move story (parent issue)
to "In Progress" status after they have already moved a sub-task to "In Progress".
They feel that the story should automatically be moved to "In Progress" once any subtask of story has been moved to "In Progress".
fields.summary: A user can transition story to in progress when subtask is moved to in progress.

fields.description:
becauHi,

I had this request today.

{quote}filling our planning board for the next SCRUM, we have the following problem:
1) Filter issues on : Severity, priority 
2) This shows a list in the best order for us to solve the issues.
3) We would like to rank this list for top to bottom, to reflect this selection in our planning board. For this we would have to be able to batch change the rankings of the JIRA issues. 
When we currently go to the planning board, the sorting order does not reflect the sorted order in the filter. Having a lot of issues open, it takes a lot of work to manually change the ranking in the planning board. Is there a clever method of adjusting the ranking to reflect the filter sort order.
{quote}

It seems to me it would be nice to be able to say "Take the order the issues appear to me in right now and set this as the ranked order", with appropriate warning and permission restriction of course.

Cheers,

Ximon

{panel:title=Workaround}To work around this issue in GreenHopper 6.1.3 or later, please try the following steps:
# Determine your preferred rank order field (for example, I'll use Story Points)
# Create quickfilters for each valid Story Point value - ex, Story Points = 1, Story Points = 2, Story Points = 3, Story Points = 5, etc
# Enable the quick filter that corresponds with the lowest-rank tickets
# Select all Cards shown
# Disable quick filter
# Right click one of the Cards that are still selected
# Select Rank To Bottom
# Repeat steps 3-7 until complete{panel}
fields.summary: Set ranking values based on current sort order

fields.description:
We noticed that it is possible to change JIRA's components and versio fields through Greenhopper for those issue types, which does not have those fields visible on JIRA.

We have this kind of "small-task" sub-task issue, which has only workflow Open->Close and only summary+some other fields. It does not have component and version field, because it does not need those. It is like checkbox.. "remember -> done".

This fights a little bit against scrum, but that works for us.

Hopefully Greenhopper respects JIRA field and screen schemes on future version.

BR,
-JP
fields.summary: It is possible to set JIRA's Component/s and Version fields for Issues which does not have those fields
